data.title: UCLA Registrar’s Office
data.text:
Announcements

More information is available for most announcements; see the announcements archive.

Registrar business hours

Get answers and information from the Registrar’s Office, virtually through Zoom or in person at 1113 Murphy Hall. Virtual and in-person hours are Monday-Friday 10 a.m. to 12 noon and 1 p.m. to 3 p.m., except holidays.

Registrar closed August 28

On Wednesday August 28, the Registrar’s Office will be closed all day for a staff event. Regular business hours resume on Thursday, August 29.

Registrar closed September 11

On Wednesday September 11, the Registrar’s Office will be closed all day for a staff event. Regular business hours resume on Thursday, September 12.

Graduate student transit pass

Effective winter quarter/spring semester 2024, the BruinGO Universal Access Transit Pass fee gives graduate students unlimited access to Los Angeles County public transportation.

New Nursing doctorate degree

Effective fall 2024, the School of Nursing will offer a new, state-supported Doctor of Nursing Practice degree. The self-supporting Doctor of Nursing Practice degree also continues to be offered.

New Molecular, Cell, and Developmental Biology master’s degree

Effective fall 2023, the Molecular, Cell, and Developmental Biology department offers a new MS degree. The Molecular, Cell, and Developmental Biology MA has been disestablished.

New Disability Studies bachelor’s degree

Effective fall 2023, the College of Letters and Science offers a bachelor’s degree (BA) in Disability Studies. The capstone major examines disability as a social, cultural, and aesthetic construct. Students participate in an internship at a service or policy institution.

New Creative Writing minor

Effective fall 2023, a new minor in Creative Writing is offered by the English department. The minor focuses on the craft of writing poetry or short fiction, and explore other writing practices including creative nonfiction, screenwriting, and writing for digital media.

New health data science master’s degree

Effective fall 2023, the Biostatistics department offers a self-supporting Master of Data Science in Health (MDSH) degree. The program is designed for working professionals to become well-trained, professional health-data analytics leaders.
